titleStmt.title: Henry H. Farmer et al. to Beriah Magoffin

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To Governor Beriah Magoffin
Henderson Ky June 10th 1862

Whereas Wm Leeg was this day fined sixty dollars for selling liquor on his premises at an election held there and there are some extenuating circumstances attending the sale we respectfully petition your excellency to remit the fine,

Mr Leeg was solicited for several elections by some respectable citizens to furnish refreshments and liquors on election days. Being ignorant of the laws he finally yielded sold but a small amount and lost by the operation Since that time which has been some time and several elections have intervened he has steadily refused to sell more. Mr Leeg is a steady industrious and respectable citizen and quite poor.

Henry H Farmer
Henry, Lewis
S, C, R, Priest
W, S, Hicks
Wm. B Floyd
D. D. Lockett
John R Knight
M J Moss
C C Eades
G. A. Sugg
